diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome secondary to Shiga-toxin-producing Escherichia coli O104:H4 infection
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by clinical findings of acute renal failure, thrombocytopenia, and hemolytic anemia in the 12-year-old boy, as well as the presence of Shiga toxin in stool samples from the family members who had ingested bean sprouts associated with the outbreak.
